entities: United Nations Organization's Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), particularly resolutions 1493 and 1533,
Reaffirms its commitment to the DRC's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and political independence.
It reiterates support to the Government of National Unity and Transition of the DRC,
 Expressing deep concern over ongoing tensions and hostilities in Eastern DRC, particularly in North and South Kivu and Ituri district,
Reaffirms readiness to support the peace and national reconciliation process through MONUC,
 Welcoming MONUC's readiness to participate in a joint verification mechanism with DRC and Rwanda,
 Noting the situation in DRC continues to threaten international peace and security,
1. Extends MONUC's mandate, under Chapter VII, until 1 October 2004;
2. Requests the Secretary-General to report on MONUC's mandate execution by 16 August 2004;
3. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
